channel.title: Text file list
channel.description:
How can I read and write to a textfile on a line by line basis? I need to be able to add a new line, and to be able to read any line. I only know how to read and write and overwrite the first line.
I wrote a script that finds prime numbers by checking divisibilty of a few smaller prime numbers in an open ended array. When it finds a prime number it does setarray length to make it bigger and adds to this array on the fly. This work fairly well, but after a while the array gets really big and the memory adds up. So I want it to make the list on a textfile, adding a new line at the bottom when it finds a new prime number, and returning the prime on any specified line. Also, this means it doesn't have to start from the beginning each time you run the script because it can start from the where the textfile left off.
If there isn't a simple way to do this, but there is a complicated way, it needs to use less cpu and memory than the current way with no textfile, or there's no point lol.

item.title: Text file list
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Boreas:

Thanks, I think I could get that setting thing to work, the only thing is, is this information saved in a file on the hd or in memory?

I’m not sure it’s saved but it’s permantly saved I belive.

Read full topic

item.title: Text file list
item.dc:creator: @Boreas Boreas
item.description:
@Boreas wrote:

The memory option would be like the array I have now except that it could pick up where it left off.

The file way looks better, but can it add new lines without overwriting whats already there and can it read line by line? The more I read into this the more it looks like pascal blows.

Read full topic

item.title: Text file list
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath.v2 Aftermath.v2
item.description:
@Aftermath.v2 wrote:

This is saved in memory.

To save to a file,
[scar]WriteFileString(TheFile, ‘lol teh string’ + chr(13))[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Text file list
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Well, I belive there is no default function to read a file’s line.

To use case, you need a var of somthing. Here’s a simple script to show a use for case…of: [scar]procedure WritelnString(num : integer);
begin
case num of
1 : Writeln(‘String number 1’);
2 : Writeln(‘String number 2’);
end;
end;

begin
WritelnString(2);
end.[/scar]

That’s just a little example depending on what you want. If you want to store data while the script is off, you can use the “SaveSetting” and “LoadSetting” command. I’ll post another example:[scar]var
i : integer;
s : string;

begin
i := Random(152)+1;
SaveSetting(‘Test’, ‘iInteger’, IntToStr(i));
i := 5;
s := LoadSetting(‘Test’, ‘iInteger’);
Writeln('The integer I before we changed it was ’ + s);
end.[/scar]

Using both of these samples I’m sure you can do what you wanted to do. (Example, using case to store the strings/integers then SaveSetting/Loadsetting to save for future use.

Read full topic
